thread.title: Socorro County opposes wolf recovery program
thread.title_full: Socorro County opposes wolf recovery program | Albuquerque Journal News

author: ABQnews Staff
title: Socorro County opposes wolf recovery program
text:
The Socorro County Board of Commissioners voted this week to oppose the Mexican wolf recovery program.
The commissioners passed a resolution Tuesday opposing the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service’s program to reintroduce the Mexican wolf in the wild – especially in Socorro County, according to a report in El Defensor Chieftain.
The commissioners also approved the publication of a proposed ordinance that would make it illegal to release wolves on ranch land in Socorro County, although there were questions about whether such a rule could be enforced on federal land, according to the report.
A public hearing on the proposed ordinance would be held before the commission votes.
A new management rule that took effect in February expanded the area where Mexican wolves may roam and includes Socorro County.
The recovery area now stretches from Interstate 40 to the U.S.-Mexico border.
